metadata.title: CVE-2020-11713 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
wolfSSL 4.3.0 has mulmod code in wc_ecc_mulmod_ex in ecc.c that does notproperly resist timing side-channel attacks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11713` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl24 - 4.4.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0+dfsg-2').
